title: Sava
summary: The Sava (/ˈsɑːvə/;[2] Slovene pronunciation: [ˈsàːʋa],[3] Serbo-Croatian pronunciation: [sǎːʋa];[4] Serbian Cyrillic: Сава, Hungarian: Száva) is a river in Central and Southeast Europe, a right tributary of the Danube. It flows through Slovenia, Croatia and along its border with Bosnia and Herzegovina, and finally through Serbia, feeding into the Danube in its capital, Belgrade. The Sava forms the main northern limit of the Balkan Peninsula, and the southern edge of the Pannonian Plain.
